item.title: it@cork Annual Conference Announced
item.dc:creator: conor
item.description: The it@cork annual conference has just been announced. Its title is “GREEN IT: Reduce CO2, Raise Profits” and it’s on November 26 in the lovely Radisson SAS Hotel in Cork. The line-up looks like an excellent mix with the focus being clearly on Green as it relates to IT and Business. I particularly like the [...]
item.content:encoded:
The it@cork annual conference has just been announced. Its title is “GREEN IT: Reduce CO2, Raise Profits” and it’s on November 26 in the lovely Radisson SAS Hotel in Cork.

The line-up looks like an excellent mix with the focus being clearly on Green as it relates to IT and Business. I particularly like the profit angle given the turmoil the world is going through right now

The is an Early Bird Discount available â€“ Book on or before October 31 and it’s â‚¬250 for members, â‚¬350 for non members.

The agenda is as follows:

07.30 â€“ Heads of IT breakfast sponsored by Certification Europe

08.00 â€“ Arrival coffee & registration

08.45 â€“ Welcome from Donal Manning, Chairman, it@cork

08.55 â€“ SETTING THE SCENE â€“ George Lee, Economics Editor, RTE

09.35 – Green IT: Moving Beyond the 2% Solution, Douglas Neal, Research Fellow, Leading Edge Programme

10.05 – SMART2020: ICT and climate change. Opportunities or Threat? Chris Tuppen, Director Sustainable Development, BT

10.35 â€“ Q&A Moderated by Tom Raftery. Lead analyst, energy and sustainability practice, Redmonk

10.50 â€“ Coffee sponsored by Complete Telecom

11 20 – Virtual Worlds: making organizations greener, Pierre-Olivier Carles, Co-Chief Stonfield InWorld

11.40 – Measuring the energy footprint of everything on Earth, Gavin Starks, Director, AMEE

12.00 – The Electric Grid 2.0, Fergus Wheatly, General Manager, Allied Solar Ltd

12.20 – Q&A Moderated by Damien Mulley, Mulley Communications

12.35 â€“ LUNCH sponsored by Lenovo

13.45 – Situation normal, everything must change, Simon Wardley, Independent Consultant

14.35 â€“ The Business Challenges of the Future Low Carbon Economy, Niall Brady, Green Sigma Technical Development Manager, IBM

14. 55 â€“ Green IT @ STRATO, Rene Weinholtz, Executive Director for IT & Innovation, STRATO

15.15 â€“ Q&A Moderated by Dan Barry, Enterprise Ireland

15.30 â€“ Coffee Sponsored by Premiere Global Services

16.00 â€“ Green Computing – A leadership role, Tom Moriarty, EMEA Regulatory and Environmental Manager, DELL

16.30 â€“ Green ICT – How ICT will help deliver ESBâ€™s Sustainability Strategy, Padraig McManus, CEO, ESB

17.00 â€“ Q&A Moderated by Tom Raftery followed by drinks reception sponsored by Smart Telecom

After October 31st, the rate is â‚¬300 for members and â‚¬400 for non members.

See you there!
